key_risks: Legal and financial risks from asbestos-related lawsuits and successor liability litigation
Supply chain vulnerabilities due to reliance on raw materials like steel and rare metals
Economic sensitivity tied to cyclical industries such as construction and energy
Regulatory compliance challenges across multiple regions
Intense competition from industry players like Lincoln Electric and Miller Electric
controversies: Asbestos-related lawsuit with allegations of unjust enrichment and responsibility for subsidiary actions
Litigation as the alleged successor to Charter Consolidated and Central Mining & Investment Corporation
Past environmental violations, including a $39,620 EPA fine in 2016
Labor relations violations, including a $50,000 NLRB fine in 2008
environmental_issues: Past environmental violations, including a $39,620 EPA fine in 2016
Commitment to sustainability with a goal of 50% renewable energy by 2030, but ongoing compliance risks
social_issues: Labor relations violations, including a $50,000 NLRB fine in 2008
Historical ethical concerns despite having a Code of Conduct for Business Partners
governance_issues: Legal exposure from lawsuits and successor liability claims
Regulatory compliance challenges in diverse operating regions

sources.title: ESAB Corp. ESG Risk Rating - sustainalytics.com
sources.snippet: ESAB, spun off from Colfax in 2022, is a leading manufacturer of equipment and consumables used in welding, cutting, and joining applications. Alongside competitors Lincoln Electric and ITW's Miller brand, ESAB is one of the top three players in the welding space. ESAB generated roughly $2.8 billion in revenue in 2023.

sources.title: ESAB Corporation 2024 Sustainability Report
sources.snippet: The report highlights ESAB Corporation's sustainability initiatives and progress made during the year ended December 31, 2023. The company expanded its commitment to reducing greenhouse gas emissions to 50% by 2035, from its initial goal of 30% by 2030, and committed to having 50% of its global electricity come from renewable energy sources by 2030.
